name: 4-fluoro-2-(trifluoromethyl)benzoic acid

The influence of each functional group on the melting point is as follows: (1) The carboxylic acid group (–COOH) significantly raises the melting point due to its capability of forming strong hydrogen bonds. This group can add approximately +100°C to the melting point. (2) The trifluoromethyl group (–CF3) attached to the benzene ring is a highly electronegative and bulky group, which increases the melting point by adding additional dipole-dipole interactions and steric hindrance. This addition can be estimated to increase the melting point by around +20°C. (3) The fluorine substituent on the benzene ring introduces additional polarity over a hydrogen atom, contributing to stronger intermolecular forces, and is expected to increase the melting point by about +5°C. When considering these functional groups together, the overall estimated increase in the melting point of the compound can be quantified.
